keyword: calories in a cup of sugar
title: Calories in a Cup of Sugar
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of sugar—about 774 kcal from pure carbs—plus full nutrition breakdown per 100 g, totals, and variations like brown sugar.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Sugar
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 US cup = 200 g (standard measure, not packed).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type, brand, granularity, and measurement method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides ~774 kcal, entirely from carbohydrates with no protein or fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use powdered sugar (sifted, ~120 g per cup)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of sugar?
faqs.a: About 774 kcal for one cup (200 g) of granulated white sugar.
Yes, 100% carbohydrates—200 g carbs and sugars in one cup, with 0 g protein or fat.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a cup?
faqs.a: One cup granulated sugar weighs 200 g, providing 200 g of sugars.

faqs.q: Calories in brown sugar vs white?
faqs.a: Brown sugar has similar calories (~380 kcal/100 g), but one cup is denser at ~836 kcal.
Yes—packed cups weigh more (up to 220 g, ~861 kcal); sifted or loose is less.
